question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought: George can only give a report on Tuesday, so eliminate options A and C. Nina gives a report, then Helen and Irving must give reports the next day unless Nina's report is on Wednesday. In B, Nina gives a report on Wednesday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In D, Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In E, Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In A and C, George can't give a report on Tuesday, so the rules about Nina are not violated, but this does not make the option valid, as it was eliminated due to George not being on Tuesday.
full_output:
<think>George can only give a report on Tuesday, so eliminate options A and C. Nina gives a report, then Helen and Irving must give reports the next day unless Nina's report is on Wednesday. In B, Nina gives a report on Wednesday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In D, Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In E, Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday, which is valid. In A and C, George can't give a report on Tuesday, so the rules about Nina are not violated, but this does not make the option valid, as it was eliminated due to George not being on Tuesday.</think>
<ans>B</ans>
hint_sentence: When considering the rule about Nina giving a report, be cautious not to assume a specific day for Nina's report unless the condition explicitly states that it must be on a particular day.

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following is a pair of students who, if they give reports on the same day as each other, must give reports on Wednesday?
A) George and Lenore
B) Helen and Nina
C) Irving and Robert
D) Kyle and Nina
E) Olivia and Kyle
chain_of_thought: Nina's report can be on Tuesday. If Nina's report is on Tuesday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday. If Nina's report is on Wednesday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday as well. Therefore, if Helen and Irving give reports on the same day as each other, they must give reports on Wednesday. Since neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, their afternoon reports can only be on Monday, which means Helen and Irving must be on Tuesday or Wednesday. The only day they can be on together is Wednesday. This eliminates options A, D, and E. Now, if Nina gives a report on Tuesday, George cannot be on Wednesday, so it must be option C: Irving and Robert.
full_output:
<think>Nina's report can be on Tuesday. If Nina's report is on Tuesday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday. If Nina's report is on Wednesday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on Wednesday as well. Therefore, if Helen and Irving give reports on the same day as each other, they must give reports on Wednesday. Since neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, their afternoon reports can only be on Monday, which means Helen and Irving must be on Tuesday or Wednesday. The only day they can be on together is Wednesday. This eliminates options A, D, and E. Now, if Nina gives a report on Tuesday, George cannot be on Wednesday, so it must be option C: Irving and Robert.</think>
<ans>C</ans>
hint_sentence: When a rule says "unless," it means that the action described by the rule is only allowed if the condition preceding the "unless" is not met. Analyze the condition preceding the "unless" to determine when the action is allowed or not.

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If George, Nina, and Robert give reports and they do so on different days from one another, which one of the following could be true?
A) Helen gives a report on Wednesday.
B) Nina gives a report on Monday.
C) Nina gives a report on Tuesday.
D) Olivia gives a report on Monday.
E) Robert gives a report on Wednesday.
chain_of_thought: Nina must give a report on Tuesday because Tuesday is the only day she can. If Nina gives a report on Tuesday, then on Wednesday, Helen and Irving must give reports. Since George gives a report on a different day than Nina, George must give a report on Monday. Robert gives a report on a different day than Nina, so Robert must give a report on Wednesday. This leaves one report on Tuesday, which must be given by either Helen or Irving, but neither can be on Tuesday unless Nina’s report is on Wednesday. Since this is a contradiction, option C is the only valid option because it doesn’t conflict with any other rule.
full_output:
<think>Nina must give a report on Tuesday because Tuesday is the only day she can. If Nina gives a report on Tuesday, then on Wednesday, Helen and Irving must give reports. Since George gives a report on a different day than Nina, George must give a report on Monday. Robert gives a report on a different day than Nina, so Robert must give a report on Wednesday. This leaves one report on Tuesday, which must be given by either Helen or Irving, but neither can be on Tuesday unless Nina’s report is on Wednesday. Since this is a contradiction, option C is the only valid option because it doesn’t conflict with any other rule.</think>
<ans>C</ans>
hint_sentence: When Nina gives a report on Wednesday, the condition that Helen and Irving must both give reports on the next day is automatically waived.

A) Irving, Lenore, and Nina
B) Lenore, George, and Irving
C) Nina, Irving, and Lenore
D) Robert, George, and Irving
E) Robert, Irving, and Lenore

<ans>B</ans> 

This answer choice is the only option that satisfies the conditions given in the problem.
